intro: Effusiella flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible effusiella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often creeping stems that can form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy surface. Effusiella flexuosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky crevices.
